page.title: 18A farmworker's day.
page.content: Mr.Bedford is foreman on a 977 acre farm in Rowston.Thefarm is owned by Dennis Estates.575 acres wheat,125 acres oilseed rape,98 acres sugar beet,58 acres peas,30 acres potatoes,15 acres spring barley,1 acre asparagus and 75 acres grass. There four men and a foreman to work the farm. Working hours 7.30a.m.-4.30p.m. There is half an hour for lunch and tea.After 4.30p.m. is overtime. Friday July 5th. 1985. Sprayed wheat for mildew and aphids. Turned 12 acres of hay. Bailed 12 acres of hay. Cut 10 acres of hay. Bailer broke fetched new parts from Townsends in Metheringham. All men finished work at 8.30 p.m.
